title: Manage projects - OpenProject
content: On this page   Project structure   Select a project   Create a new project   Create a subproject   Project Settings Project structure Select a project Create a new project Create a subproject Project Settings Manage projects In OpenProject you can create projects to collaborate with your team members, track issues, document and share information with stakeholders, organize things. A project is a way to structure and organize your work in OpenProject. Your projects can be available publicly or internally. OpenProject does not limit the number of projects, neither in the Community edition nor in the Enterprise cloud or in Enterprise on-premises edition. Your browser does not support the video tag. Project structure Projects form a structure in OpenProject. You can have parent projects and sub-projects. A project can represent an organizational unit of a company, e.g. to have issues separated: Company (Parent project)  Marketing (Sub-project) Sales HR IT â¦ Marketing (Sub-project) Sales HR IT â¦ Projects can also be for overarching teams working on one topic: Launch a new product  Design Development â¦ Design Development â¦ Or, a project can be used to separate products or customers. Product A  Customer A Customer B Customer C Customer A Customer B Customer C Note You must be a member of a project to view and work in it. Select a project Find out how to open an existing project in OpenProject in our Getting started guide. Create a new project Find out how to create a new project in OpenProject in our Getting started guide. Create a subproject Find out how to create a subproject in OpenProject in our Project settings guide. Project Settings You can specify further advanced settings for your project. Navigate to your project settings by selecting a project, and click -> Project settings -> Information. Here you can: Define whether the project should have a parent by selecting Subproject of. This way, you can change the project hierarchy. Define whether the project should have a parent by selecting Subproject of. This way, you can change the project hierarchy. Enter a detailed description for your project. Enter a detailed description for your project. Set the default project Identifier. Set the default project Identifier. Set a project to Public. This means it can be accessed without signing in to OpenProject. Set a project to Public. This means it can be accessed without signing in to OpenProject. Read the full guide on project settings in OpenProject.
